isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STOPMASTER WEDGE TYPE BRAKE - ADJUST - AUTOMATIC ADJUSTERS

svcproc.title: AUTOMATIC ADJUSTERS
svcproc.para: New System or Complete Reline and Drum Reconditioning:

step1.para: Cage spring brake units manually or by air pressure. Check, clean, and apply penetrating lubricant to the adjusting bolt if accessible.

warning.para: Do not attempt to release (cage) the spring brake when the spring brake shows structural damage. Caging the spring may result in the forceful release of the spring chamber and its contents which could cause death, severe personal injury and/or property damage. Remove complete spring brake chamber and replace with new unit.

step1.para: Manually adjust brakes for heavy drag. (Make periodic static brake applications to position floating shoes.)

Back off adjusters to .020-.040 inch (0.508-1.016 mm) clearance. Measure at the crown (center) of the shoe, using a long feeler gauge to permit checking the entire lining width. A light drum drag should be evident. If not, check for misaligned or bent shoes, improper lining grind, drum runout, etc.

caution.para: Do not rely on automatic adjusters to take up excessive initial clearance. Also, adjusters may not function if adjusting bolts are tight against the plunger. Dual-actuated brakes will not adjust on stationary vehicle.
